noun.description: A short stiff hair, typically one of those on an animal's skin, a man's face, or a plant.

verb.description: (of hair or fur) stand upright away from the skin, especially in anger or fear.
examples: the hair on the back of his neck bristled

verb.description: Be covered with or abundant in.

origin: Middle English: from Old English byrst (of Germanic origin, related to German Borste) + -le.
